caption: The service was 8/10 and the burger was really good.  The fries were cold and tasted stale.  After  I complained they served a fresh batch of hot fries...100% better. I would definitely recommend the burger with 🔥fries.

This review is just based on bar service.  Not very impressed with this particular establishment at Armature Works. I went here when it was in the late evening. It's a nice bar area, but overpriced and the service can be hit or miss even when not busy. The pours are okay and come in a plastic cup with a hard stop line of where to pour. It keeps it consistent, but I just prefer a glass instead.  I'd just rather hit up one of the other bars while here. Just not my first pick.

$25 for these, not impressed and would definitely recommend another place if you’re in the area. We will if we come back here. Parm fries were a very weak attempt at a loaded type shareable. 3 tiny fingers and another small side of fries to consider it a real meal. I had to order elsewhere just to deal satisfied. Still waiting that order. 👎🏽

I deliberately ordered from this restaurant because curbside pickup was advertised. When I got to the designated location and called their phone, no one picked up. Valet told me curbside pick up doesn’t exist. After I walked through armature works (huge crowds, not many masks) and picked up my food, I asked why curbside is advertised as an option. The attendant said “I don’t know” and walked away.

The bartender last night was extremely rude. We did not know the policy about having to be seated at the bar to be able to drink. All we were doing was standing behind people and sipping wine and she started yelling and CUSSING at us out of nowhere. We would have respected the policy had she said it in a nice way. Not appreciated and very unprofessional. Even when we first sat down and ordered a flight she didn’t explain anything to us about the wines, seemed like she really didn’t even wanna be there. Worst customer service any of us have ever received at a wine bar.
We did a wine tasting at the Cru Cellars at Armature Works and the wine selection was pretty good! The pours were generous and the staff was friendly!

I'm a firm believer in playing to strengths and not holding weaknesses against businesses. Cru is known for wine- if you're at Armature Works and want a nice glass of wine, go to Cru. The prices are varied, so groups work. The selection is great. If you're hungry... Well, go to somewhere known for food. That being said- 4 stars because I think their menu is a little out of reach for them. Otherwise an amazing option for drinks :)

Not worth the money at all. The fries were cold ask to get them warmed up never apologized just gave me the tray back. Food doesn’t look nothing like pics. Cashier to busy talking to attend to details.
Ordered $24 cheese plate and was given little slithers of cheeses and crumbles. Not worth the money. Olives and nuts were soggy.
Good food

We had such a great experience @Cru inside Armature works. The steak frites with cilantro with truffle fries & Cru red wine were a perfect pairing. Shout out to Liz who provided wonderful customer service, delightful conversation, and inspired us to visit the other Tampa location. We will be inviting our friends next time!
Great food and great service

Ordered the new steak sandwich and fries. The pictures of the steak sandwich looks great. At $16 I figured I was going to get a nice small sirloin. When it came out the “steak”  looked like one thinly sliced piece of shaved steak that usually goes on a Philly steak sandwich. It also had one leaf of arugula and a couple of tomato slices on a nice buttered bun. Single cheeseburgers at McDonald’s have three times the meat that was included in this sandwich.  The waiters and waitresses never asked myself or anyone around me “how is everything?” My guess is that they've learned  not to ask that question after they had received many negative responses.   If there was a 1/2 star rating for this meal that’s what I would have given it. Stay away!  I just read your response and I did not think it possible, but your recovery effort was less impressive than our experience. No, I won't be giving you another try, even if you offered a complimentary meal which you failed to do

One star for customer service and one star for the fries.I get to rate the meat from 1-3 stars and  I give them 0. The chief doesn't know how to cook medium well, and absolutely struggled with the well done. You are high end place bring a high end chief

The food was horrible! Ordered the Steak frites. First off the fries were cold and limp. The steak was cooked prefect med. rare but for some reason it was cool to the touch. Took it back and they said they would remake it. They had it ready in less than 5mins. The fries looked like they were just reheated and the steak was almost fullly cooked through. It looks like everything is pre-cooked then reheated. Also the bernaise sause was cold and chunky like cheese spread. The steak wasn't seasoned and the fries were even over salted. Super small portions. The amount of food you get for the piece is Totally not even worth it. $16 for maybe, if you're luckey to even get 4oz's of steak and a handful of fries.

Gabrielle was a great bartender and she did an excellent job with presenting the wines. We had the Sauvignon Blanc and the Farmers Board which was excellent.You will have a nice date night here! Enjoy and salud!!

Great selection of wines. Very friendly and knowledgeable servers. The signature Steak Fries menu item has wonderful sauces, the chimichurri Is a very good take on the real thing and the House Steak sauce is great! The steak done with sous vide method did not have that buttery texture and that savory steak flavor was just not there....the fries were great! Perfectly cooked toasted skin but wonderfully cooked on the inside.
Always great wine and recommendations!
Great wine selection

Need to give this place another shot when it is not crazy busy. Ordered the Ybor Chicken which was supposed to be spicy but not spicy at all. It was still very good but when you want spicy, you want spicy! Service was fast even with as busy as it was. Seating was horrible, we had to poach a table from people who were probably not ready to leave but us hovering over them helped our cause. Added: Fries were amazing! And they gave us enough that our entire group was able to snack on them!

Bartender was uneducated about the wines, ordered a flight and I swear it was watered down, ordered Ybor Chicken sandwich which has a description of 'spicy ', had to ask for extra sriracha, and bartender spent 70% of the time on her phone.
